advisory.name: RLSA-2022:7730
advisory.synopsis: Moderate: libldb security, bug fix, and enhancement update
advisory.topic:
An update for libldb is now available for Rocky Linux 8.
Rocky Enterprise Software Foundation Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
advisory.description:
The libldb packages provide an extensible library that implements an LDAP-like API to access remote LDAP servers, or use local TDB databases.
The following packages have been upgraded to a later upstream version: libldb (2.5.2). (BZ#2077484)
For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
Additional Changes:
For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Rocky Linux 8.7 Release Notes linked from the References section.

fixes.description: Rebase libldb to the version required by Samba
CVE-2022-32746 samba: AD users can induce a use-after-free in the server process with an LDAP add or modify request
python3-ldb-devel sub-package is missing from CRB
